page.title: 11Our School
page.content: Ashchurch School was built in 1842 by the church who employed the architect William Hill Knight.When the school was built it was a National School. Later it was changed to a Board School (in 1872).The datestone on the front of the school says "ASHCHURCH BOARD SCHOOLS A.D.1842. Glory to God in the Highest." The original building was divided into two schools, one for the girls and one for the boys.The girls' room was much smaller than the boys'.Behind the school was the master's house.There were some stairs coming into the school.The school was enlarged in 1894 when they added the main building which is now the library.All the other classrooms (mostly temporary buildings)were built in the 1950's;two are about to be demolished.There are now 132 children in the school.
